greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) counts ordered complete ternary trees with 2*n-1 leaves having k internal vertices colored black, the remaining n-1-k internal vertices colored white, and such that each vertex and its rightmost child have different colors.
comment: Compare with Examples 1.6.7 and 1.6.9 in [Drake]. This triangle is a refinement of A027307. Compare with A175124.
link: B. Drake, An inversion theorem for labeled trees and some limits of areas under lattice paths, A dissertation presented to the Faculty of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences of Brandeis University.
formula: O.g.f.: compositional inverse of x-b*x^3/(1+b*x^2)-w*x^3/(1+w*x^2) = x +(b+w)*x^3 + (2*b^2+6*b*w+2*w^2)*x^5 + ....
example: Row 3: 2*b^2+6*b*w+2w^2. Internal vertices colored either b(lack) or w(hite); 5 uncolored leaf nodes shown as o.
results.author: _Peter Bala_, Sep 29 2011
